title: Why can't brand new players be matched in Bronze games?
body: I'm not saying I am super high elo but as a silver I am trying to get to gold and it just doesn't work out when I have a brand new player as my jungler.

replies.body: Because some are better than bronze just by being able to use a keyboard and mouse simultaneously. We silver players arent as good as we think we are.

I'm not saying Silver players are good but they're better than brand new players. I don't want a brand new player to the game to try to gank for me and give kills. I also do not want to take part in THEIR learning experience.

you were one of those people not long ago (im assuming). If you look at silver like the starting point for league then its not a bad system as it. Getting demoted to bronze in this view is worse than being brand new.

Of course I was Silver but being Silver in 2015 is WAY different than it is now. The game is too volatile for there to be new players in the game at even Silver 3. I placed gold 1 last season on my main account and so much has changed since then it’s just so bad now especially how snow bally everything is. If I can’t manage to snowball myself we lose. If you look at my most recent games I went 4/2 in one game where I had a brand new player playing lee sin and 2 other unranked players. I do not like those people weighing me down and that’s exactly what they did. They were a burden and did not know how to pressure or evaluate the map.

If theyre bad they will fall. You cant arbitrarily place everyone in bronze because theyre not all that bad. Silver is a shit show but some rank has to be it. If anything, I feel the argument needs to really be made for another rank below bronze for this reason.

Do you think that discourages people more from the game, at least ranked if their first 10-20 games is them being stomped then going to bronze? It makes them feel like trash, where if they basically are just placed in mid bronze they might just look at it as (everyone starts here). I know bronze, silver, and even gold players are not that great, but the jump from bronze 1 to gold 5 is pretty big and having people that hit level 30, and do placements probably wont be able to keep up if they are not smurfing.

I’ve alwas believed you learn more from losing than winning so I personally don’t see an issue with it. Being new to a game like this and losing rank when new should be expected. Some people might one trick the first 30 levels and be semi decent mechanically and stay silver. Pretty much any online competitive game I’ve played I knew I wasn’t the best starting and didn’t expect a high rank. Obviously some games are different but the attitude going in is usually the same

I can't remember the exact numbers, but I believe 50% of the league player base - which plays ranked - are at or below silver 3.

This puts silver 3 as the "middle" point skill wise. Half are better, half are worse, and it's the best place to start someone.

Also: You will never have a 'brand new' player as your jungler. You will have a player who managed to hit level 30, which takes a moderate amount of games. And if you're in a place where you're consistently getting placed with people who are just stepping into ranked.. I'd wager that there's a reason for it.

The problem is also that Silver has a ton of players who just don't play enough to climb IMO. Honestly, you'll find a huuuuuuge gap in terms of skill sometimes, and I'll look at their match history and they just don't play often.

The average player is low silver skill level when they start ranked statistically speaking, so it makes most sense to start at that average rather than have more than 50% of those new to ranked players just stomp bronze games.

Also, those new players make it easier to get to gold, not harder. Theres 5 potentially clueless new players on the opposing team, versus 4 on your own, so you'll benefit more often than you lose from such players.

Not to say it doesn't feel bad to have one of those clueless folks on your own team, but players that haven't had their skill properly assessed have to start somewhere, and it's gonna feel bad for people involved in those games when the starting guess is wrong, whether it's people getting stomped or people needing to deal with a monkey. Placing people at the statistical average just means most people will not have far to go to before they get to their proper mmr, instead of a whole bunch of people needing to stomp as they climb, or a whole bunch of people ruining teammates games as they fall.
